"Sect" has negative connotations and implies a unity and cohesiveness that does not exist.
/* Speaking in tongues */ removing repetitious and unnecessary statements

/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ disambiguating wikilink
/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ wikilinking "faith"
/* Denominations and adherents */ Ok before another denomination is claimed as the largest in India, WP needs a source. Thank you.
/* Ordinances and practices */ removing unnecessary comma
/* Ordinances and practices */ Names for communion
/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ Removing incomplete sentence.
/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ italics for emphasis
/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ word choice
/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ Clarifying that it is Christ who baptizes in the Spirit.
1 addition is not included in the source cited. 1 edit is pov.
The Church of God (Cleveland) is already mentioned in the article, therfore there is no use in its being mentioned in "See also".

Reverted edit by [[Special:Contributions/203.193.219.32|203.193.219.32]] identified as vandalism using [[Wikipedia:STiki||STiki]]
/* Origins */ Clarifying where these radical evangelical movements were.
/* Ordinances and practices */ Summarizing OP baptismal beliefs and directing the reader to the OP section below which repeats this same information.
/* Ordinances and practices */ Expanding on practices for healing prayer.
/* Classical Pentecostalism */ Adding source on distinctions between Wesleyan and non-Wesleyan and added links for "Reformed" and "Baptistic".
/* Classical Pentecostalism */ Adding explanation of Wesleyan and non-Wesleyan beliefs on sanctification.
/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ Cleaning out non-essential clause.
/* Sub-groups */ According to Edith Blumhofer in Restoring the Faith, the Assemblies of God is non-Wesleyan.
/* Independent groups */ Removing stray qoutation mark.
/* Sub-groups */ Removed alot of the unsouced information about the Word of Faith movement and expanded the sections coverage to other independent movements within Pentecostalism.
Moving information from the lead to the section on Classical Pentecostalism.
/* Word of Faith movement */ emphasizing that the word of faith movement is not apart of classical Pentecostalism.
/* Word of Faith movement */ adding source to verify that it is part of Pentecostalism
/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ with ==> in
/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ Making distinction between salvation and Spirit baptism clearer.
Adding source, removing citation needed tag.
/* Speaking in tongues */ Trying to simplify.
Per discussion on talk page, I have rearranged the introduction to lessen confusion over the Charismatic labels.
/* Beliefs */ Added cessationist distinction between evangelicals and Pentecostals.
add url, fix phrases according to source

article is [[baptism in the Holy Spirit]]; source cited says 'Spirit'
Pentecostalism is a movement within charismatic christianity
This is about salvation, not clothing standards, and it is not about the UPCI alone. Also, nice plug, but this is not why Wikipedia exists.
/* Salvation */ This article said something along the lines of,"penticostals don't believe that you must speak in tongues to enter the kingdom of God." I just fixed it and added basic beliefs.

The "and/or" construction is discouraged as not proper grammatically.
The em dash is there for a reason. [[WP:MOS]]
This is Wikipedia, not the Catholic encyclopedia. We have a Neutral Point of View, see [[WP:NPOV]].
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
Revert some recent additions that don't seem in keeping with the encyclopedic nature of the article.
/* Word of Faith teachings */ copy edits, requesting sources
Bible isn't a source. Wikipedia needs a source that says "Oneness Pentecostals believe this biblical passage says this." It's not enough to quote scripture, saying they interpret this without proof.

restoring NOV quote (which is of Acts, not directly of Joel): see Talk page

/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ changed wording for POV purposes, "acknowledge" sound like an admission of something that all know to be true, but some are holding out against
/* Spirit baptism and spiritual gifts */ correct typo in previous edit
/* Speaking in tongues */ Adding use of the term "prayer language".

/* Europe */ Removing material not dealing with Europe.
/* See also */ Removing links mentioned in article.
/* History from 1900 */ Section heading level change.
/* Women */ Drastically reduced the size of the "Women" sections.
Added predecessors in the early Church.

[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 307193126 by [[Special:Contributions/Ltwin|Ltwin]] ([[User talk:Ltwin|talk]]) See talk page
Reverted edits. Many of the terms are proper names. Pentecostalism, Pentecostal are proper names as they refer to a religious movement just as Methodism or Roman Catholicism.
/* Salvation */ removed capitalization of terms not proper names
/* Oneness Pentecostalism */ removed capitalization of terms not proper names
/* Charismatic Movement */ removed capitalization of terms not proper names
/* Denominations and adherents */ removed capitalization of terms not proper names
/* Word of Faith teachings */ removed capitalization of terms not proper names
/* Finished Work */ removed capitalization of terms not proper names
/* Holiness and Higher Life Pentecostalism */ removed capitalization of terms not proper names
/* Overview */ removed capitalization of terms not proper names
/* North America */ removed capitalization-not a proper names
/* Europe */ removed capitalization-not a proper names
/* History to 1900 */ removed capitalization-not a proper name
/* Faith */ "Faith" by itself can cover many topics, whereas this section is about the "Word of Faith," specifically
/* Denominations and adherents */ No reference given.
/* Neo-charismatic movement */ wikilinked new article ''[[Dictionary of Pentecostal and Charismatic Movements]]''
/* Neo-charismatic movement */ lower case, for consistency (this is the capitalization used in the ''Dictionary'')
/* Charismatic Movement */ added new section on neo-charismatics
/* External links */ ''Christian History'' special issue added
/* Salvation */ Despite the fact that you might think it is clear, to others it isn't so clear. It is an interpretation.
/* Latter Rain Movement */ added link to separate article on Latter Rain Movement
I have added more places in Scripture where the Apostle's baptized people, as opposed to simply Acts 2:38. I also omitted the interpretation comment, since it is literary fact, not interpretation.

/* Speaking in tongues */ Speaking in tongues is not "ecstatic". Contrary to popular myth there is no loss of normal control.
/* Speaking in tongues */ Contrary to a popular myth speaking in tongues is not "ecstatic". It does not involve any loss of normal control.
